review.body:
Great way to end a wonderful series

I loved seeing everything come full circle and that most of the demons were worked out. I hope Con gets his own story but we shall wait and see! Great read!
love, love, love this series!

It was cool

I liked watching jack take a stand, not sure I agree with how his parents handled it but reading about some one standing up for theme self was cool

book.title: Blackstone and the Burning Secret (Inspector Sam Blackstone #4)

review.body: Series continues to be interesting, humorous and inventive.

book.title: To All the Boys I've Loved Before (To All the Boys I've Loved Before, #1)
book.publisher: Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers

review.body: I ended up really liking this book! It began slow for me and I wasn't sure if I was going to take to it but I had really been wanting to try a Jenny Han book. It picked up quickly and I really enjoyed the relationship between the main character and the boy pretending to be her boyfriend.
Good book, I enjoyed it. I would reccomend it to my friends, but it would be more fun if they started with #one

book.title: The Married Billionaire's Surrogate: An African American Pregnancy Romance For Adults

review.body:
What

Sorry, I didn't like this story at all. The storyline was bad and I didn't like the characters. The heroine cried through the entire story and the hero's wife was crazy.
This book should be subtitled Sarah Harding saves the motherf***ing day

To me, this series with all of the novellas is dragging on too long. I don't mind getting a peek inside their HEA during a novel with a new H/h...but to keep having novellas with the same characters is too much.
This picture book has wonderful illustrations, simple text as a bear politely continues asking various animals if they've seen his hat...then ends with a hilariously dark joke. Love it!

This was a fun science fiction novel. Think Jack London meets MacGyver set in space. The narrator Mark Watney is left for dead on Mars, and he has to figure out how to survive on the unforgiving planet until he's rescued. Most of the plot is driven by engineering challenges Mark faces. He also ne...

book.title: Diary of an Empty Enderman: Search for the Enderwoman [An Unofficial Minecraft Book] For kids who like: Minecraft Diaries, Minecraft Books for Kids, Minecraft ... Minecraft Stories (Minecraft Tales Book 20)

review.body:
Boring

I could not read half way through it . but I want dairy of a angry Alex 10 please .

An unexpected best friends turned lovers romance. I really enjoyed all the humor in this book, it made their friendship more believable.

Thanks Netgalley for the free review copy, in exchange for an honest review.

I adored this book! The author is a popular UK blogger but I hadn't hear of her-- just stumbled upon the book and it was fab. I listened to the audiobook on this one and the narrator did a great job too. Such a cute, well told love story.

I loved "The Darlings" and I loved this. Cristina Alger really knows how to involve the reader in a character and a story. This was unpredictable and lovely and surprising in the best ways, and I'd hand it over to anyone in need of a good, engrossing read.
I guess this is my favorite book of all time.

book.title: The Darkest Part of the Forest

review.body:
My first Holly Black book - of whom I am now a fan, *sighs/fangirls*

Beautiful, beautiful story written oh-so well. No disappointments or awkwardnesses - just so smooth and magical and lovely and real. I am so happy, having devoured this deliciously told story.

I found Growing up Greene by Charles L. Gaby to be a wonderful memory of growing up in small town usa. The stories were told in a wonderful manner and were fun to read. Great job Charles I look forward to reading more by this talented author.

Me reconozco fanática de Lorraine Cocó pero éste es el libro que menos me ha gustado de ella, contando que sólo me queda leer uno. Está bien, porque está bien, pero cuando te acostumbras a un nivel tan bueno, mejorar los libros que tiene en el mercado reconozco que debe ser difícil.
Another wonderful collection of tales from the pen of Bob Brooks. Free to buy too - well worth a look. Very traditional stories, in the vein of Animals of Farthing Wood.
